testName: ICT2641 Chapter 4 Quiz: Business Analysis Service Framework

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of the Business Analysis Service Framework (BASF)?
options: To outline the responsibilities of project managers
To clarify the services offered by business analysts
questions.correctAnswer: To clarify the services offered by business analysts
questions.explanation: BASF defines the range of services business analysts provide, offering structure and clarity.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT one of the six core services in the BASF?
questions.explanation: Stakeholder Management supports all services but is not a standalone core service in BASF.

questions.text: What is the main value proposition of the 'Situation Investigation and Problem Analysis' service?
options: To define test cases for business solutions
To identify and define business needs and problems
questions.correctAnswer: To identify and define business needs and problems
questions.explanation: This service helps uncover root causes of business issues and clarify opportunities for improvement.

questions.text: Which technique is commonly used in the 'Feasibility Assessment and Business Case Development' service?
questions.explanation: Cost-benefit analysis helps determine the financial viability of proposed business solutions.

questions.text: What is the focus of the 'Business Process Improvement' service?
questions.explanation: This service evaluates current processes to suggest enhancements and achieve better outcomes.

questions.text: Which service involves eliciting, analyzing, and documenting requirements?
questions.explanation: Requirements Definition focuses on capturing, validating, and managing business and technical needs.

questions.text: What is the goal of the 'Business Acceptance Testing' service?
options: To train users on new systems
To ensure the solution meets business needs
questions.correctAnswer: To ensure the solution meets business needs
questions.explanation: Business Acceptance Testing validates that the delivered solution aligns with the defined requirements.

questions.text: Which of the following is a key activity in the 'Business Change Deployment' service?
questions.explanation: Assessing readiness helps ensure the organization is prepared for the upcoming business changes.

questions.text: What is the role of stakeholder engagement in the BASF?
options: It is not part of the framework
It is only relevant during testing
questions.explanation: Stakeholder engagement is a cross-cutting theme, essential for success across all BASF services.

questions.text: What does the OSCAR acronym help define in the context of BASF?
questions.explanation: OSCAR helps frame the scope, context, and responsibilities within a business analysis engagement.

questions.text: Which of the following best describes the purpose of the 'Requirements Definition' service?
options: To define and manage stakeholder relationships
To elicit, analyze, and document business and IT requirements
questions.correctAnswer: To elicit, analyze, and document business and IT requirements
questions.explanation: This service defines the foundation upon which the solution is designed and implemented.

questions.text: What is a key technique used in the 'Business Change Deployment' service?
questions.explanation: Training needs analysis identifies skills gaps and informs support for users during change implementation.

questions.text: Which service includes activities such as defining test scenarios and supporting business testing?
questions.explanation: This service ensures the business validates that the solution fulfills its requirements.

questions.text: What is the main focus of the 'Feasibility Assessment and Business Case Development' service?
options: Evaluating solution options and supporting investment decisions
questions.correctAnswer: Evaluating solution options and supporting investment decisions
questions.explanation: This service helps in selecting viable solutions and justifying them with structured business cases.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT typically a technique used in 'Situation Investigation and Problem Analysis'?
questions.explanation: Investment appraisal is used in business case evaluation, not in problem investigation.

questions.text: What is the purpose of the OSCAR acronym in defining Terms of Reference?
options: To structure the scope and objectives of a business analysis service
questions.correctAnswer: To structure the scope and objectives of a business analysis service
questions.explanation: OSCAR helps define what the service entails, its boundaries, and expected outcomes.

questions.text: Which service is most likely to involve the use of BPMN or UML activity diagrams?
questions.explanation: BPMN and UML activity diagrams are commonly used to visualize and improve business processes.

questions.text: What is the final stage in the Isaksen and Treffinger problem-solving model?
questions.explanation: Acceptance Finding ensures that the selected solution is accepted and implemented effectively.

questions.text: Which of the following is a key activity in the 'Requirements Definition' service?
questions.explanation: Understanding users is critical to defining relevant and effective requirements.

questions.text: What is the role of the strategic context in the BASF?
options: It ensures alignment of services with organizational goals
It replaces the need for stakeholder engagement
questions.correctAnswer: It ensures alignment of services with organizational goals
questions.explanation: Strategic context ensures that each service in BASF contributes to the organization’s broader objectives.

questions.text: Which of the following best describes the 'Business Acceptance Testing' service?
options: It ensures that the business case is financially viable
It validates that the solution meets defined business requirements
It defines the training needs for end users
questions.correctAnswer: It validates that the solution meets defined business requirements
questions.explanation: Business Acceptance Testing confirms the solution’s alignment with agreed requirements before deployment.

questions.text: What is a key output of the 'Feasibility Assessment and Business Case Development' service?
questions.explanation: The main deliverable is a business case that justifies investment and outlines feasible options.

questions.text: Which technique is most appropriate for identifying root causes during situation investigation?
questions.explanation: Fishbone diagrams are effective tools for identifying underlying causes of problems.

questions.text: What is the purpose of the 'Business Change Deployment' service?
options: To support the transition and adoption of business changes
questions.correctAnswer: To support the transition and adoption of business changes
questions.explanation: This service ensures smooth implementation and organizational adoption of business changes.

questions.text: Which of the following is a typical activity in the 'Requirements Definition' service?
questions.explanation: Prototyping helps clarify requirements and validate solutions early in the development process.

questions.text: What is the role of the business analyst during 'Business Acceptance Testing'?
options: To write code for the solution
To define and support test scenarios
questions.correctAnswer: To define and support test scenarios
questions.explanation: BAs ensure the solution is tested against the business requirements they helped define.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a typical technique used in 'Business Process Improvement'?
questions.explanation: ERDs are used in data modeling, not for analyzing or improving business processes.

questions.text: What does the 'Acceptance Finding' stage in the problem-solving model focus on?
options: Gaining stakeholder buy-in for the solution
questions.correctAnswer: Gaining stakeholder buy-in for the solution
questions.explanation: This stage ensures the solution is accepted and supported by key stakeholders for successful implementation.

questions.text: Which service is most likely to involve training needs analysis and readiness assessment?
questions.explanation: Training and readiness assessments are critical for successful change adoption and support.

questions.text: Which of the following best describes the relationship between BASF and strategic context?
options: BASF replaces the need for strategy
BASF is only used in Agile environments
BASF services should align with strategic goals and architecture
BASF is only relevant for IT projects
questions.correctAnswer: BASF services should align with strategic goals and architecture
questions.explanation: For maximum value, BASF services must be grounded in the strategic direction of the organization.
